Question: This person made four short subjects for comedy pioneer Mack Sennett in 1932 and 1933, distributed through Paramount Pictures.
Hints: Upon discovering the prank, this person was heard to yell, "Who put pineapple juice in my pineapple juice?".
In 1971, Dodd, Mead reprinted it when this person was seen as an anti-establishment figure.
This person embellished stories of his youth, but his home seems to have been a reasonably happy one.
